docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Scott’s unpopularity in Florida has led political strategists to wonder whether the state’s voters will again lean toward President Obama in 2012.

headline.print_headline: Sinking Poll Numbers May Put Florida in Play

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Gerard cared for champions like Kelso and Secretariat but imported a horse that ran as a ringer who won at odds of 57 to 1.

headline.seo: Mark Gerard, 76, Veterinarian at Center of a Horse Race Fraud
headline.main: Mark Gerard, Veterinarian at Center of a Horse Race Fraud, Dies at 76
headline.print_headline: Mark J. Gerard, a Racing Veterinarian Involved in a Horse Switch, Dies at 76

docs.abstract: Mark J Gerard, veterinarian who cared for champion race horses and was involved in a notorious 1970s horse identity switch, dies at age 76.
docs.snippet: Dr. Gerard cared for champions like Kelso and Secretariat but imported a horse that ran as a ringer who won at odds of 57 to 1.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bill George is a professor of management practice at Harvard Business School and a former chairman and chief executive of Medtronic. He is the author of four best-selling books, including “True North.”
